articles.title: Working Contact for Joint Research into Volcano on Mt. Paektu Held
articles.content:
Working Contact for Joint Research into Volcano on Mt. Paektu Held
 Pyongyang, April 12 (KCNA) -- The second inter-Korean working contact for the joint research into the volcano on Mt. Paektu was held in Kaesong on April 12.
					 At the contact the north side stressed again that the working contact was aimed at discussing technical issues of pushing forward the joint researches into the volcano on Mt. Paektu and put forth a proposal concerning the timing and venue of an academic symposium on the joint research and a field study and their scope and modality and contents, etc. It proposed adopting an agreement on them.
					
					 The south side talked about "mode of access", "principle" and "a phased plan", while acknowledging the necessity of the joint researches into the volcano on Mt. Paektu. It made an absurd assertion that sixth months are required for a preliminary study and more than two years for a full-dress study and it is necessary, therefore, to hold an academic symposium at the next phase.
					
					 It repeatedly insisted that the north side should pass data on the indications of the volcano on Mt. Paektu on it, to begin with.
					
					 After making a serious note of the unreasonable attitude on the part of the south side, the north side explained that if the proposed symposium and field study are put into practice, the exchange of data would automatically take place. It repeatedly urged the south side to accept the draft agreement. 
					
					 Nevertheless, the south side wasted a lot of time, groundlessly insisting that the data on the indications of the volcano on Mt. Paektu be handed over to it, first of all. Then it came out with what it called a "MOU" making a long explanation about "mode of access", "principle" and "a phased plan" without any binding force, deliberately throwing a hurdle in the way of discussion.
					
					 Finding its far-fetched assertion no longer workable and it was held accountable for the breakdown of the contact, the south side walked out of the venue of the contact. It wasted a total of four hours till it received an instruction from the Seoul authorities. Finally it was compelled to sign the draft agreement put forth by the north side.
					
					 The agreement said that the north and the south share the understanding of the need to promote the joint research into the possible eruption of the volcano on Mt. Paektu and decided to open the symposium in Pyongyang or in a place convenient for both sides early in May, make a joint field study of the possible volcano on Mt. Paektu in the middle of June and discuss specific technical matters related to those events by cooperating with each other.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Congratulates President of Kazakhstan
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Congratulates President of Kazakhstan
Pyongyang, April 12 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on April 6 sent a congratulatory message to Nursultan Nazarbayev on his reelection as President of Kazakhstan.
					 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Kazakhstan would expand and develop in line with the desire of the two peoples, the message wished him greater success in his work for the prosperity of his country and the well-being of its people.

articles.title: Choe Ryong Hae Meets Chinese Delegation
articles.content:
Choe Ryong Hae Meets Chinese Delegation
 Pyongyang, April 12 (KCNA) -- Choe Ryong Hae, secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, met and had a friendly talk with the delegation of the All-China Federation of Trade Unions led by Vice-President Zhang Mingqi at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Tuesday.
					 The delegation was deeply moved to see the achievements made by the Korean workers in various domains during the stay, the head of the delegation said.
					
					 Wishing the Korean people greater success in socialist construction under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il, he expressed the will to further strengthen the friendly and cooperative relations between the workers of the two countries.

articles.title: Cuban Ambassador Gives Reception
articles.content:
Cuban Ambassador Gives Reception 
 Pyongyang, April 12 (KCNA) -- Jose Manuel Galego Montano, Cuban ambassador to the DPRK, gave a reception at his embassy on Tuesday on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung. 
					 Present there on invitation were Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, Kim Yong Il, secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, Kim Yong Jin, chairman of the Education Commission, Ri Ryong Nam, minister of Foreign Trade, Kim Jong Suk, chairwoman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, Pak Jae Gyong, vice-minister of the People's Armed Forces, and Kim Hyong Jun, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs. 
					
					 Staff members of the embassy were present there. 
					
					 The ambassador said in his speech that Kim Il Sung dedicated himself to the struggle for turning the DPRK into an independent and developed socialist country. 
					
					 The achievements made by the Korean people under the leadership of Kim Jong Il greatly please the Cuban people, he added. 
					
					 Expressing hope that the fraternal relations between Cuba and the DPRK provided under the special care of the top leaders of the two countries would grow stronger, he expressed belief that the Korean people would emerge victorious in socialist construction and the struggle for the country's reunification. 
					
					 Yang said that the Cuban people's commemoration of the Day of the Sun every year is a manifestation of the Cuban party, government and people's boundless reverence for Kim Il Sung. 
					
					 He referred to the fact that Kim Jong Il is paying deep attention to the development of the friendly and cooperative relations with Cuba. 
					
					 He hoped that the government and people of Cuba would make successes in defending socialism and the gains of revolution under the leadership of Fidel Castro Ruz and Raul Castro Ruz.

articles.title: Film Show Arranged by Russian Ambassador
articles.content:
Film Show Arranged by Russian Ambassador 
						
Pyongyang, April 12 (KCNA) -- Valery E. Sukhinin, Russian ambassador to the DPRK, arranged a film show at his embassy on Tuesday on the occasion of the 50th anniversary of the first manned-space flight by Yuri Gagarin.
					 Present there on invitation were Ri Song Uk, vice-president of the State Academy of Sciences, and other officials concerned.
					
					 Staff members of the Russian embassy here were on hand.
					
					 Speeches were made there to be followed by a show of Soviet documentary film "The History of Launch of Satellite into Space."

articles.title: Malaysians Pay Homage to Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Malaysians Pay Homage to Kim Il Sung
 Pyongyang, April 12 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the United Malays National Organization of Malaysia led by Dato Haji Tajuddin Bin Abdul Rahman, member of its Supreme Council, Tuesday visited the statue of President Kim Il Sung on Mansu Hill to pay homage to him.
					 The delegation laid bouquets before the statue with boundless reverence for the President and made bows to him.
					
					 It arrived here on Tuesday.

articles.title: Mexican Party Leader Arrives
articles.content:
Mexican Party Leader Arrives 
						
 Pyongyang, April 12 (KCNA) -- Alberto Anaya Gutierrez, coordinator of the National Coordinating Committee of the Workers' Party of Mexico, arrived here on Tuesday to commemorate the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Foreigners Arrive
articles.content:
Foreigners Arrive
 Pyongyang, April 12 (KCNA) -- Personages of different countries came here today to attend a consultative meeting of senior officials of the international preparatory committee for commemorating the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					 They included co-chairmen of the international preparatory committee Ibrahim Mantu, former deputy president of the Senate of Nigeria, Yousef Al Amiri, chairman of the Kuwait-DPRK Friendship Association, and Anders Kristensen, chairman of the Denmark-DPRK Friendship Association, secretaries of the international preparatory committee Martin Lotscher, chairman of the Switzerland-Korea Committee, and Javed Ansari, secretary general of the Karachi Branch of the Pakistan-Korea Friendship Association, C.P. Mainali, general secretary of the C.C., the Nepal Communist Party (Marxist-Leninist) who is chairman of the Nepalese national preparatory committee, Sumiko Shimizu, representative of the Japanese Women's Society for Solidarity with the Korean Women who is chairwoman of the Japanese preparatory committee, and Alejandro Cao de Benos, chairman of the Korean Friendship Association headquartered in Spain who is chairman of the KFA preparatory committee.
					
					 Also arriving today were Raymond Ferguson, national secretary of the Australia-DPRK Association for Friendship and Culture who is vice-chairman of the Asia-Pacific regional preparatory committee. 
					
					 Arriving on the same day were Johnny Hon, chairman of the International Kim Il Sung Foundation, and his party, Omar Lopez Perez, vice-chairman of the Latin American Institute of the Juche Idea, Matteo Carbonelli, secretary general of the European Society for the Study of the Juche Idea, Kamwiziku Octave, secretary general of the African Regional Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, a delegation of the Secretariat of the International Institute of the Juche Idea headed by Hiroko Takizawa, a delegation of the Study Forum for Self-Reliance of Nepal led by Chairman Subash Kaji Shrestha, a delegation of the Bangladesh Institute of the Juche Idea led by Mohammad Shamsul Ikram, Wang Dongping, general manager of the Kimilsungia and Kimjongilia Greenhouse in Dandong, China, and his party and Li Xiangjun, vice-secretary general of a branch of the China Flower Association, and his party.

articles.title: Floral Basket from Family of Ya. T. Nobichenko
articles.content:
Floral Basket from Family of Ya. T. Nobichenko
 Pyongyang, April 12 (KCNA) -- A floral basket was sent to the statue of President Kim Il Sung on Mansu Hill by the family of Ya. T. Nobichenko, an internationalist soldier, on the occasion of his birth anniversary. 
					 The floral basket was placed before his statue on Tuesday.

articles.title: Gift from Foreign Organizations
articles.content:
Gift from Foreign Organizations 
 Pyongyang, April 12 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a gift jointly presented by the Arab Information Center in Beijing and the Public Center for Diplomatic and Cultural Exchange of China.
					 The chairman of the Arab Information Center in Beijing handed the gift to Ji Jae Ryong, DPRK ambassador to China, on April 9.

articles.title: DPRK Has Long Drought
articles.content:
DPRK Has Long Drought
						
 Pyongyang, April 12 (KCNA) -- The DPRK has experienced a long spell of dry weather caused by a continental high pressure.
					 Up to now, the country's precipitation is only 20.1 mm or 33 percent of the average, the lowest since Juche 66 (1977) that recorded 17.9 mm.
					
					 The northern area on the east coast has 12 % of the average, northern inland area 18 %, the northern area on the west coast 23 %, northern highland area 28 %, central inland area 34 %, central area on the west coast 40 % and central area on the east coast 52%.
					
					 The major drought-plagued areas are Heoryong City (0.1 mm), Rason City (1.4 mm) and Taehongdan County (3.8 mm) and Jagang, Ryanggang and North Hamgyong provinces had less than 10 mm for 100 days.
					
					 Pyongyang, Sinuiju, Sariwon, Haeju and Kaesong cities and some other west coastal areas had no rainfall for 97 days.
					
					 A weather forecast shows the drought will persist in the country next week, too.
					
					 The dry weather has adversely affected this year's farming.

articles.title: Order of DPRK Awarded to Chinese
articles.content:
Order of DPRK Awarded to Chinese
 Pyongyang, April 12 (KCNA) -- The Order of DPRK Friendship was awarded to Chinese citizens who displayed noble internationalism in the DPRK.
					 The Order of DPRK Friendship 1st Class was conferred on Zhang Jingrong, a Chinese businessman who sacrificed himself to save Korean girls while working in the DPRK, and the Order of DPRK Friendship 2nd Class on Yuan Xingwang, his colleague.
					
					 A ceremony of awarding the orders took place at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Tuesday.
					
					 Present there were Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, officials concerned and Wang Zhilin, economic and commercial councilor of the Chinese embassy here.

articles.title: Agricultural Workers' Oath-taking Meeting Held
articles.content:
Agricultural Workers' Oath-taking Meeting Held
 Pyongyang, April 12 (KCNA) -- An oath-taking meeting of agricultural workers was held in Oguk-ri, Anak County, South Hwanghae Province of the DPRK on Tuesday. 
					 Ri Myong Gil, chairman of the C.C., the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea, made a report at the meeting which was followed by speeches. 
					
					 The speakers noted that President Kim Il Sung established the best socialist rural economic system in Korea and put forward the common peasants as the master of the country. 
					
					 They expressed the determination to devote their all to achieving the prosperity of the country under the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il, cherishing the President's warm love and trust. 
					
					 They underlined the need to radically increase the grain production and, at the same time, turn the farms and villages into socialist land of bliss, thus carrying into brilliant reality the WPK's far-reaching plan for rural construction.

articles.title: Trees Planted in Arboretum of Kumsusan Memorial Palace
articles.content:
Trees Planted in Arboretum of Kumsusan Memorial Palace 
 Pyongyang, April 12 (KCNA) -- Officials of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League and youth planted trees in the arboretum of the Kumsusan Memorial Palace Tuesday on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Officials of the Central Committee and Pyongyang and Nampho city and North Hwanghae and South Phyongan provincial committees of the league and youth trucked thousands of trees of more than 40 species.
					
					 They planted the trees with great care.

articles.title: April Art Festival Performances Go On
articles.content:
April Art Festival Performances Go On 
						
 Pyongyang, April 12 (KCNA) -- The second-day performances of the 27th April Spring Friendship Art Festival took place at theatres in Pyongyang on Tuesday. 
					 Artistes of the Soloists Ensemble "Classic Avantguard" of Belarus successfully performed such pieces as Korean song "General on a Galloping White Horse". 
					
					 A female vocal soloist of the group of famous artistes from the State Symphony Orchestra of Mongolia impressively sang the song "Grasslands of Mongolia" depicting scenery of Mongolia. 
					
					 The dance troupe of the Kiev Dance Theater of Ukraine represented its people's life and custom through folk and other dances.
					
					 Artistes of the Folk Art Troupe "Izvor De Valcea" of Romania put on the stage male solo and folk dance reflecting the sentiment and emotion of the Romanian people. 
					
					 Artistes of the German Soloists of Creusen Concert, the Vienna Wind Players of Austria and the Chamber Orchestra Alberic Magnard of France showed their skillful techniques through cello and piano duet "Le Grand Tango", wind-instrument concert "Song of Spring" and "Comme d'habtude" composed by Claude Francois, etc. 
					
					 A female soloist of the art troupe of the International United Confederation of Koreans eagerly sang the song "I Wish to Meet the President" with her yearning for President Kim Il Sung who devoted all his life to the happiness of the people. 
					
					In mixed duet "Convey Our Pride of Being Led by the General" Korean artistes from China showed well their will to always cherish the day when they performed in the presence of General Secretary Kim Jong Il visiting China.
					
					 At the Moranbong Circus Theatre there were performances by the Chinese circus troupe and the groups of the Circus of State Acrobatic Company and the Nikulin Moscow Circus of Russia.
					
					 The performances will go on.

articles.title: Drain Closed Up at Huichon Power Station No. 2
articles.content:
Drain Closed Up at Huichon Power Station No. 2
Pyongyang, April 12 (KCNA) -- A project for building dam for Huinchon Power Station No. 2 was finished in the DPRK, successfully closing up its drain on April 9. This vast project was carried out in a little more than two years since its ground breaking.
					 As a result, the River Chongchon stopped its flow, making it possible to store enough water needed for electricity production.
					
					 This also opened a bright prospect for accelerating the operation of the station.

articles.title: Methane Tank for Generating Electricity
articles.content:
Methane Tank for Generating Electricity
						
 Pyongyang, April 12 (KCNA) -- The Institute of Animal Husbandry of the DPRK has made a methane tank for generating electricity.
					 It absorbs sunlight and converts it into thermal energy. It also raises the inner temperature to ferment microorganism. Its gas output is much larger than hydraulic one.
					
					 The electricity generated by methane is enough to operate the institute.
					
					 The methane tank using livestock excrement is considered more effective than hydraulic methane tank.
					
					 It works well in all seasons.

articles.title: Documentary Film Shown
articles.content:
Documentary Film Shown 
 Pyongyang, April 12 (KCNA) -- Documentary "Finding Himself among the People All His Life" (6) was screened at the People's Palace of Culture on Tuesday on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The film deals with the immortal exploits performed by the President who put forward the unique line of building up the economy and defence simultaneously and wisely led the work to implement it, thus turning the country into a socialist power independent in politics, self-supporting in the economy and self-reliant in national defence. 
					
					 The film shows the historical days when the President led all the people to hastening socialist construction with rifle in one hand and hammer and sickle in the other hand to further increase the nation's economic and military capability. 
					
					 It impressively deals with the fact that he provided a national meeting of families of martyrs and disabled soldiers and showed warm benevolence for the bereaved families and the disabled soldiers. 
					
					 It tells about the undying exploits of the President who trained the Korean People's Army, driving force of the Songun revolution, into an invincible army and turned the whole country into an impregnable fortress by establishing the all-people, all-state defense system. 
					
					 Appreciating the film were senior party and state officials, the chairperson of a friendly party, officials of working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions and working people in the city of Pyongyang.

articles.title: Orchards in DPRK Undergo Metamorphosis
articles.content:
Orchards in DPRK Undergo Metamorphosis
 Pyongyang, April 12 (KCNA) -- Orchards in different parts of the DPRK have undergone an amazing metamorphosis in recent years.
					 The Ryongjon Fruit Farm in South Hamgyong Province removed its orchard on hills to a vast field and planted short apple trees. It also spruced up a room for disseminating agricultural sci-tech, fruit sorting station, stockbreeding base and other facilities.
					
					 The Kwail County Combined Fruit Farm in South Hwanghae Province increased the production of high-yield fruit saplings twice the number of the past and changed the appearance of its orchard. The farm provided good conditions for admirably raising the size and weight of each fruit by ensuring lopping in summer, thinning and other processes in a scientific and technological way and producing much quality manure.
					
					 The Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm in Pyongyang has become one of the eleven Songun sceneries in the country.
					
					Vast projects for increasing the capacity of the farm were carried out one after another, including land realignment for an orchard of hundreds of hectares, digging trench-style pits extending more than 4,000-ri (1,600km), setting up hundreds of thousands of props for fruit trees and planting millions of fruit trees.
					
					 After finishing on a high level the work to put the fruit production on a scientific, intensive and modern basis, the farm is pushing ahead with project for additionally building a field of hundreds of hectares for short apple trees.
					
					 The Kosan Fruit Farm in Kangwon Province, too, created a big orchard extending several hundred hectares and planted more than one million high-yield short apple trees. It also built dwelling houses.
					
					 The farm fulfilled the fruit production plan 58 percent last year and is working hard to bring good harvest this year, too.

articles.title: Corn Dishes Become Popular
articles.content:
Corn Dishes Become Popular
						
 Pyongyang, April 12 (KCNA) -- There is a corn food restaurant in Central District, Pyongyang.
					 The restaurant serves various corn dishes like noodle, bread, pancake and zeppole, as well as corn tea.
					
					 The corn dishes prepared by the restaurant are as tasty as wheat dishes.
					
					 What is most popular among the dishes is corn noodle mixed with cucumber soup, broiled cabbage and mushroom.
					
					 Ryom Sol Mi, manager of the restaurant, told KCNA that the restaurant has steadily improved the corn processing method to diversify corn food.

articles.title: Chollima Statue
articles.content:
Chollima Statue
						
 Pyongyang, April 12 (KCNA) -- The Chollima Statue is standing on Mansu Hill in Pyongyang. 
					 Chollima is a legendary horse running 400 kilometers a day. 
					
					 The statue consists of a bronze sculpture of a male worker and a female peasant riding Chollima and a granite column of light gray color.
					
					 The worker holds high a letter issued by the Workers' Party of Korea Central Committee and the peasant takes a sheaf of rice in her arms.   
					
					 They represent the Korean people bringing about epoch-making changes in the country.
					
					 One day in November Juche 47 (1958), President Kim Il Sung suggested erecting the statue symbolizing the revolutionary mettle of the Korean people.
					
					 He paid close attention to the project from the design of the statue and its erection.
					
					 The statue was unveiled on April 15, Juche 50 (1961).

articles.title: KCNA Denounces S. Korea for Offering Land for US Military Bases
articles.content:
KCNA Denounces S. Korea for Offering Land for US Military Bases 
 Pyongyang, April 12 (KCNA) -- The ruling quarters of south Korea continue committing such treachery as offering land for U.S. military bases.
					 Even at this hour dozens of bulldozers and heavy duty lorries sent by the group of traitors are busy removing earth in the area of Phyongthaek for the construction of a U.S. military base. 
					
					 The construction of the Phyongthaek military base expected to be completed by 2015 covers 4.44 million phyong (one phyong equals six square feet) or nearly 80 times the area of Tok Islets. It would be the largest of the U.S. military bases overseas. 
					
					 There will be the U.S. 8th Army Command, barracks, garages, a mobile drill ground, firing range, lodging quarters and even a golf course and other amusement and entertainment facilities. 
					
					 The south Korean authorities' offer of the fertile land of the nation to the aggressors is sycophancy and treachery putting the crimes committed by the five traitors of 1905 into the shade. 
					
					 The U.S. military bases in the areas north of the River Han are being moved to areas south of it at a time when U.S. military bases are now being transferred to other areas or new ones are under construction in south Korea.
					
					 The Phyongthaek U.S. military base under construction will house U.S. imperialist forces present in the Ryongsan base in Seoul, Tongduchon and Uijongbu. 
					
					 These moves are aimed to carry out the U.S. sinister scenario to save its personnel from the merciless strikes of the Korean People's Army and use the south Korean troops as human shields and cannon fodder in case a war breaks out on the Korean Peninsula. 
					
					 Nevertheless, the south Korean ruling quarters are taking the lead in the transfer and expansion of the U.S. military base, even offering a huge amount of fund collected from the south Korean people as taxes. This cannot but be shame on the nation as it is as deplorable an act as playing into the U.S. crafty method to spark a fratricidal war. 
					
					 The land of Korea is left waste and the danger of war is daily increasing owing to the U.S. military bases in different parts of south Korea. 
					
					 The south Korean authorities will never shake off their disgrace as traitors as long as they persist in offering the land handed over by the ancestors as U.S. military bases.

articles.title: S. Korean Minister of Unification's Remarks for Confrontation Blasted
articles.content:
S. Korean Minister of Unification's Remarks for Confrontation Blasted
 Pyongyang, April 12 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, Deputy Minister of Unification of south Korea Om Jong Sik again mouthed the issue of "expenses for unification" and talked about "making preparations for it in advance". He also let loose piffle that it is necessary to lead the north to changes, even citing Germany as an instance. He went the lengths of letting loose sheer sophism that "a nuclear power plant in the north is more dangerous" than the Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant in Japan now in a crisis.
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday observes in a bylined commentary carried in this regard: Om's remarks bring to light the south Korean authorities' evermore undisguised ambition for achieving the unification of the systems.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 It is known well that the south Korean conservative forces have worked with bloodshot eyes to realize the daydream of achieving "unification under liberal democracy," foolishly waiting for someone's "contingency" to happen. 
					
					 Mandarins of the Ministry of Unification of south Korea such as Hyon In Thaek and Om Jong Sik have taken the lead in the dangerous moves to push the inter-Korean relations to catastrophe, stoke distrust and confrontation between compatriots and ignite a war against the north.  
					
					 The inter-Korean relations still remain in the mire of the worst catastrophe though they had steadily developed since the publication of the June 15 joint declaration. It has become clearer that this is attributable to the reckless acts of confrontation maniacs making desperate efforts to do harm to the north's idea and system, regarding them as a thorn in the flesh.
					
					 But, the ambition for unifying the systems desperately pursued by the conservative group is no more than a fantastic dream which would never come true even if the sky were to fall. 
					
					 The DPRK will never overlook any act to do harm to its dignified and inviolable system and realize the criminal ambition for achieving the unification of the systems.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Exploits for National Reunification Lauded
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Exploits for National Reunification Lauded
 Pyongyang, April 12 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung is the eternal sun of the nation and the loadstar of the country's reunification as he performed the undying feats for the country and the nation by wisely leading the struggle for national reunification. Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says this in a bylined article. 
					 The article goes on:
					
					 The President advanced the cause of national reunification to victory while overcoming on his own initiative all difficulties and obstacles with his outstanding wisdom and extraordinary foresight. 
					
					 He firmly adhered to the independent spirit in the cause of national reunification, consistently maintaining the line of one Korea for reunification. 
					
					 He led on his own initiative the movement for national reunification, firmly maintaining the line of one Korea even under the complicated and difficult situation where south Korea was under the U.S. imperialists' occupation and the anti-reunification forces persistently maneuvered, backed by foreign forces. 
					
					 He put forward the three principles of national reunification, the ten-point programme of the great unity of the whole nation and the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo, which serve as guidelines for achieving the cause of reunification of the Korean nation with his clairvoyant wisdom. 
					
					 He united Koreans of different social standings close for the common cause of the country and the nation by pursuing politics with his noble humanity and compatriotism whereby he embraced everybody with his loving care.  
					
					 The exploits performed by the President for national reunification are a precious legacy providing a sure guarantee for accomplishing the cause of reunification and a reliable wherewithal for national reunification. 
					
					 Thanks to the outstanding and tested leadership of Kim Jong Il the above-said exploits of the President will be immortal and his behests for national reunification are sure to come true, concludes the article.

articles.title: Anti-"Government" Struggle Declared in S. Korea
articles.content:
Anti-"Government" Struggle Declared in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, April 12 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee for "Strength of people building new world" grouping all the progressive forces in south Korea was inaugurated on April 8.
					 A declaration, read out at its inaugural ceremony, charged that the present conservative ruling forces have committed the heinous crimes by destabilizing the people's livelihood for the past three years.
					
					 It noted that workers have been dismissed or reduced to part-timers while farmers have been undergoing the worst sufferings due to all sorts of misrule and the conclusion of Free Trade Agreement with the U.S.
					
					 Moreover, the authorities are escalating the war crisis on the Korean Peninsula by totally denying the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration and insisting on the policy of confrontation with fellow countrymen, it said.
					
					 The progressive forces, including organizations of workers, farmers, the poor, youth and students, women, intellectuals and artistes and progressive political parties, will wage a struggle against the conservative "government", the struggle against the U.S. and war and for democracy and independent reunification, the declaration said.

articles.title: Judicial Authorities' Suppression Protested in S. Korea
articles.content:
Judicial Authorities' Suppression Protested in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, April 12 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification of south Korea released a statement on April 8 condemning the unjust suppression of the puppet judicial authorities.
					 That day the Jeju District Court issued a warrant of arrest for Yang Yun Mo, a member of the organization who protested against the military authorities' scheme to build a naval base in Kangjong village in Jeju Island, the statement pointed out.
					 The real criminal is those pushing ahead with the project for Jeju naval base, it said.
					
					 We will surely check at any cost the base project which destroys the village and imposes sufferings on the inhabitants of Jeju Island, it stressed.
					
					 The statement declared that the organization would punish the judicial authorities reduced to a waiting maid of the "government" and struggle for the release of Yang.

articles.title: S. Korea Plans Anti-DPRK War Exercises
articles.content:
S. Korea Plans Anti-DPRK War Exercises 
 Pyongyang, April 12 (KCNA) -- The 1st Corps of the south Korean puppet army is staging military exercises, aimed at preemptive attack on the DPRK, in areas around Koyang and Phaju cities of Kyonggi Province on April 12 and 13, according to south Korean CBS.
					 The warmongers plan to hurl huge armed forces for attack, including trucks and helicopters, into the exercises to cope with someone's "infiltration" and "local provocation".

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Lauded by British Organization
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Lauded by British Organization 
						
 Pyongyang, April 12 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy posted a portrait of President Kim Il Sung, a photo of Kimilsungia, immortal flower, and articles on its Internet homepage on April 1 and 5 on the occasion of his birth anniversary.
					 The homepage said in an article titled "The Sun of the People" that the Korean people have held Kim Il Sung in high esteem as the sun.
					
					 This is because he organized and led the struggle for putting an end to the colonial rule of the Japanese imperialists, terminating the era of darkness when Korea had a miserable fate and bringing its people the joy of liberation, it noted, and continued: 
					
					 The President built a unique socialist system centered on the popular masses.
					
					 This socialist system is the eternal legacy left by Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The homepage noted in an article titled "President Kim Il Sung, Father of Socialist Korea, Is the Leader of the People" that he went among the popular masses from the very day he started his revolutionary struggle and won victories only by relying on their strength.
					
					 Kim Il Sung was a benevolent father of the people, indeed, and the father of socialist Korea who built a unique socialist system centered on the popular masses.
					
					 The homepage in an article titled "Mangyongdae" introduced the great lives and exploits of the members of the revolutionary family of Mangyongdae.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Exploits Lauded
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Exploits Lauded 
 Pyongyang, April 12 (KCNA) -- Roberto Gabriele, general secretary of the Movement for Peace and Socialism of Italy, issued a statement on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 He in the statement noted that he devoted himself to the people's happiness all his life.
					
					 The President built a socialist system centered on the popular masses in the DPRK, he said, and went on:
					
					 The Korean people are now living in harmony like brothers and sisters in the country free from any taxes, receiving the benefits of the universal 11-year compulsory education, the highest level of education in the world, and the perfect universal free medical care.
					
					 Kim Il Sung visited every nook and corner of the country for field guidance aimed to bring the people happiness till the last moments of his life. 
					
					 When working out a line and policy, he made sure that they fully reflected the popular masses' aspiration and requirements and when constructing a factory and a city, he saw to it that they met their interests and provided every convenience to them.
					
					 Kim Il Sung made sure that the word people was included in the names of the state and the army as he believed in the people as in Heaven.

articles.title: Colorful Events Held Abroad
articles.content:
Colorful Events Held Abroad
						
Pyongyang, April 12 (KCNA) -- Events took place in different countries from March 29 to April 5 on the occasions of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung, the 18th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and the 79th anniversary of the founding of the Korean People's Army. They included a meeting, remembrance meeting, lecture, photo exhibition and film show in Pakistan, Bangladesh, India, Brazil, Sweden and Guinea.
					 On display in the venues of the events were photos showing the revolutionary history of Kim Il Sung and revolutionary exploits of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The participants of the film show watched Korean films including "Pyongyang Today" and "Fireworks for a Thriving Nation".
					
					 Mohammad Aslam Nagi, secretary general of the Lahore Branch of the Pakistan-Korea Friendship Association, praised the immortal exploits performed by the President for the country and the revolution.
					
					 M. Jahangir Khan, advisor of the Bangladesh Barisal Society for the Study of Songun Policy, said that Kim Jong Il, carrying forward the Songun idea and exploits of Kim Il Sung, formulated the Songun politics as a basic political mode of socialism and augmented in every way the overall national power depending on the powerful military capability. 
					
					 The mayor of Campinas City, Sao Paulo State, Brazil noted that the socialist paradise built in the DPRK is the brilliant fruition of the wise leadership of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The chief of the Swedish Group for the Study of the Juche Idea said that thanks to Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the NDC of the DPRK the KPA has been firmly prepared as an army strong in ideology and faith and an invincible elite army. 
					
					 A letter to Kim Jong Il was adopted at a meeting in Pakistan.

articles.title: More Strong Quakes Occur in Japan
articles.content:
More Strong Quakes Occur in Japan
 Pyongyang, April 12 (KCNA) -- Magnitude 7.1 quake jolted the eastern part of Japan Monday. 
					 Its epicenter was about 10 km deep under water off Fukushima Prefecture. 
					
					 Tsunami warning was issued to prefectures including Ibaraki, Miyagi and Chiba immediately after the occurrence of the quake. 
					
					 It was followed by four aftershocks of magnitude of above 5.0 in the area on the same day. 
					
					The continued quake left two persons dead and 200,000 households without electricity.
					
					 Right after the occurrence of the quake the Tokyo Electric Power Co. temporarily cut off the supply of power to Reactors Nos. 1, 2 and 3 of the Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant from outside and asked those who worked around the power plant to evacuate. 
					
					 Magnitude 6.3 quake hit the area northeast of Chiba Prefecture Tuesday. Its epicenter was about 30 km deep under water off the area. 
					
					 The Japanese government began considering the raise of the accident's severity level to 7, the worst on an international scale, from the current 5. 
					
					 In the meantime, the U.S. Department of Energy made public the amounts of radioactive substances detected in the area within the radius of 80 km centering around the power plant. 
					
					 According to them, radiation of 125 microsieverts per hour was measured in the compound of the power plant. 
					
					 They said the area of more than 21 microsieverts spread 30~40 km northwest of the power plant in the shape of a band.

articles.title: Japan's Service Sector Sentiment Plunges after Quake
articles.content:
Japan's Service Sector Sentiment Plunges after Quake
 Pyongyang, April 12 (KCNA) -- Sentiment in Japan's service sector deteriorated at the fastest pace on record in March following the devastating affects of the earthquake.
					 The Cabinet Office of Japan said Friday that the diffusion index plunged to 27.7 from 48.4 in February.

articles.title: Japan Expresses Concern over World Oil Price Hike
articles.content:
Japan Expresses Concern over World Oil Price Hike  
 Pyongyang, April 12 (KCNA) -- The Japanese Finance Minister at a recent press conference expressed concern over a sharp rise in the world oil prices.
					 He predicted his country's economy might be hit hard by the sharp rise in the world oil prices.

articles.title: Russian Ambassador Expresses Concern about Japan's Linking of Radioactive Materials
articles.content:
Russian Ambassador Expresses Concern about Japan's Linking of Radioactive Materials
 Pyongyang, April 12 (KCNA) -- The Russian ambassador to Japan at a press conference on April 8 expressed concern about the release of contaminated water into the Pacific by the Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant in Japan.
					 "This makes us very uneasy in the light of the fact that radioactive materials flow into the waters off the Far East of Russia", he held, urging the Japanese side to take measures necessary for forecasting the flow of contaminated water into the Pacific and inform the Russian side of the results of its work.

articles.title: Chinese Paper Slashes at Japan's Release of Contaminated Water
articles.content:
Chinese Paper Slashes at Japan's Release of Contaminated Water 
						
 Beijing, April 10 (KCNA) -- The Chinese Huan Qiu Shibao on April 6 carried an article slashing at the Tokyo Electric Power Co. of Japan for releasing radiation-contaminated water from the Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant to the sea. 
					 Accusing the Japanese government of asserting that it was an unavoidable measure to release the contaminated water to the sea, the paper said: The contaminated water should be disposed of inside the territory of Japan in principle. It should not release the water to the Pacific unless the international community deems it as inevitable.

articles.title: China Rebukes US "Country Reports on Human Rights'' Practices for 2010
articles.content:
China Rebukes US "Country Reports on Human Rights'' Practices for 2010
						
 Beijing, April 10 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Chinese Foreign Ministry at a press conference on April 9 vehemently rejected the "country reports on human rights practices for 2010" issued by the U.S. Department of State.
					 The Chinese government has attached importance to the guarantee of human rights and its economy has made sustainable progress, he said, adding that the construction of democratic legislations has been steadily pushed forward and various nationalities enjoy more freedom and rights in various aspects.
					
					 He made it clear that China is ready to conduct dialogue on the issue of human rights with other countries on the basis of equality and mutual respect, but is strongly opposed to the U.S. interference in its internal affairs under the pretext of the human rights issue.
					
					 The U.S. should reflect on the human rights problems in its country, stop styling itself a human rights "champion" and discontinue interfering in the internal affairs of other countries by such method as issuing "country reports on human rights practices", he stressed.

articles.title: CPC Decides to Commend Its Advanced Grass Roots- level Organizations
articles.content:
CPC Decides to Commend Its Advanced Grass Roots- level Organizations 
 Beijing, April 10 (KCNA) -- The C.C., the Communist Party of China decided to commend advanced grass roots-level party organizations, excellent party members and officials on the occasion of its 90th anniversary. 
					 The Organizational Department of the C.C., the CPC recently issued a notice calling for making proper nominations throughout the country.

articles.title: Russian President on Boosting His Country's Defense Capability
articles.content:
Russian President on Boosting His Country's Defense Capability
						
 Moscow, April 10 (KCNA) -- Russian President Dmitri Medvedev at a talk on April 6 underscored the need to increase the defense capability of the country.
					 He said that any state is required to boost its defense capability, adding: "We cannot let our country go without a sufficient development of armed forces and law-abiding organs."
					
					 Russia should push forward without let-up all the reforms related to the armed forces organs including the implementation of state orders for the defense purpose because it should be ready to cope with threats from inside and outside the country, he declared.

articles.title: Drill for Eradicating Aftermath of Tsunami Held in Nakhodka, Russia
articles.content:
Drill for Eradicating Aftermath of Tsunami Held in Nakhodka, Russia
 Moscow, April 10 (KCNA) -- A drill for eradicating the aftermath of tsunami was staged in Nakhodka City, Russia on April 6.
					 The drill was staged under the simulated conditions that the coastal area of Nakhodka was swept by tsunami 4 meters high right after the occurrence of an earthquake in the waters near Japan. It was participated in by members of the relief group, medical workers, firefighters and policemen.

articles.title: Americans Doubt US Readiness for Nuclear Emergency
articles.content:
Americans Doubt US Readiness for Nuclear Emergency
						
 Pyongyang, April 12 (KCNA) -- Most Americans have expressed their skepticism about the U.S. readiness for a nuclear emergency, according to a poll published on April 8.
					 Of those polled, nearly three-fourths are somewhat or not confident about the federal government's readiness to respond to a nuclear emergency.

articles.title: Number of NATO Casualties Grows in Afghanistan
articles.content:
Number of NATO Casualties Grows in Afghanistan
 Pyongyang, April 12 (KCNA) -- The number of NATO casualties is increasing in Afghanistan.
					 Two service members of the NATO were killed in insurgent attack in southern and eastern Afghanistan on April 7.
					
					 More than 115 NATO soldiers have been killed in Afghanistan since beginning this year.

articles.title: Iraqi Government Rejects US Troops Staying in Iraq
articles.content:
Iraqi Government Rejects US Troops Staying in Iraq 
						
 Pyongyang, April 12 (KCNA) -- An Iraqi government spokesman said on April 8 that the Iraqi government is against any presence of U.S. troops in Iraq. 
					 He rejected an offer brought by the visiting U.S. defense secretary that U.S. troops can remain in Iraq beyond 2011 if requested. The Iraqi government is against any presence of U.S. troops or other foreign troops on the Iraqi territory, he said. 
					
					 The presence of U.S. troops causes internal problems in Iraq, he said, adding that the U.S. administration can not impose its will on Iraq.

articles.title: Anti-US Demo in Iraq
articles.content:
Anti-US Demo in Iraq
 Pyongyang, April 12 (KCNA) -- Thousands of Iraqis on April 8 gathered in Baghdad to protest against the U.S. forces' presence.
					 The demonstration was conducted at the same time of the visit of the U.S. secretary of Defense to Iraq.
					
					 The protesters strongly condemned the U.S. administration's plan to continue the presence of its troops in Iraq, holding banners demanding their withdrawal.

articles.title: Embajador cubano ofrece banquete por el Da del Sol
articles.content:
Embajador cubano ofrece banquete por el Da del Sol 
						
Pyongyang, 12 de abril (ATCC) -- Con motivo del da de nacimiento del Presidente Kim Il Sung, el embajador de la Repblica de Cuba en Corea, Jos Manuel Galego Montano, ofreci el da 12 un banquete en su sede diplomtica. 
					Fueron invitados el vicepresidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema, Yang Hyong Sop, el secretario del CC del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Kim Yong Il, el presidente del Comit de Educacin, Kim Yong Jin, el ministro de Comercio Exterior, Ri Ryong Nam, la presidenta del Comit Coreano de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero, Kim Jong Suk, el viceministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares, Pak Jae Gyong, y el vicecanciller Kim Hyong Jun. 
					
					Estuvieron presentes los miembros de la embajada cubana. 
					
					El embajador cubano en su discurso record que el Presidente Kim Il Sung dedic todo lo suyo a la lucha por convertir a Corea en un pas socialista independiente y desarrollado. 
					
					Destac que los xitos alcanzados por el pueblo coreano bajo la gua del Dirigente Kim Jong Il alegran mucho al pueblo cubano. 
					
					Dese que se fortalezcan las relaciones de hermandad entre Cuba y Corea preparadas bajo la atencin especial de los mximos lderes de los dos pases y expres la conviccin de que el pueblo coreano triunfar en la lucha por la construccin del socialismo y la reunificacin del pas. 
					
					Yang Hyong Sop, en su discurso, dijo que el pueblo cubano conmemora cada ao el Da del Sol como testimonio de infinita veneracin del partido, el gobierno y el pueblo de Cuba hacia el Presidente Kim Il Sung. 
					
					Se refiri a que el Dirigente Kim Jong Il presta profunda atencin al desarrollo de las relaciones de amistad y cooperacin con Cuba. 
					
					Expres el deseo de que bajo la direccin de los estimados compaeros Fidel Castro Ruz y Ral Castro Ruz, el gobierno y el pueblo cubanos obtengan xitos en la lucha por defender el socialismo y las conquistas de la revolucin.

articles.title: Proyectado documental con motivo del Da del Sol
articles.content:
Proyectado documental con motivo del Da del Sol
Pyongyang, 12 de abril (ATCC) -- Con motivo del cumpleaos del Presidente Kim Il Sung, tuvo lugar el da 12 en el capitalino Palacio Cultural del Pueblo la proyeccin del documental coreano "Entre el pueblo durante toda su vida" (sexta parte).
					El filme demuestra las imborrables hazaas del Presidente Kim Il Sung quien present la lnea original de desarrollar paralelamente la construccin econmica y la de defensa nacional y dirigi sabiamente la lucha por materializarla.
					
					 Rememora aquellos das histricos en que l condujo a todo el pueblo para que acelerara la construccin socialista con el fusil en una mano y el martillo y la hoz en la otra y consolidara as el podero econmico y la capacidad de defensa nacional del pas.
					
					 Igualmente, muestra de modo impresionante que l convoc la conferencia nacional de los familiares de mrtires y ex militares heridos y les dispens grandes benevolencias.
					
					 El largometraje destaca ingentes esfuerzos del Presidente quien form el Ejrcito Popular de Corea, grueso de la revolucin del Songun, como el invencible, estableci el sistema de defensa de todo el pueblo y todo el Estado y convirti todo el pas en un bastin inexpugnable con lo cual la patria se ostenta como potencia poltica y militar.
					
					 Disfrutaron el documental los cuadros del partido y el Estado, el presidente de partido amigo, los funcionarios de las entidades de masas, ministerios y rganos centrales y los trabajadores capitalinos.

articles.title: ATCC comenta el acto traidor del poder surcoreano
articles.content:
ATCC comenta el acto traidor del poder surcoreano
Pyongyang, 12 de abril (ATCC) -- Las fuerzas gobernantes del Sur de Corea siguen cometiendo el acto vendepatria de ofrecer el territorio surcoreano como base militar de Estados Unidos.
					En estos mismos instantes, decenas de buldzeres y camiones enviados por esa banda de traidores descuartizan la zona de Phyongthaek para instalar ah una base militar yanqui.
					
					La superficie total de la base militar de Phyongthaek, cuya construccin terminar en 2015, llega a 4 millones 440 mil phyong (3 mil phyong equivale a una hectrea), o sea, casi 80 veces de la dimensin del islote Tok.
					
					En ese enclave ms grande de las bases militares norteamericanas en el extranjero se construirn gradualmente la comandancia del octavo ejrcito norteamericano, los cuarteles, los garajes, el lugar de ejercicio mvil, el de tiro, los albergues, la cancha de golf y otras instalaciones de juego.
					
					El hecho de que las autoridades surcoreanas entregaron en bandeja a los agresores ese territorio cultivable de la nacin coreana es un acto vendepatria servil a las grandes potencias, comparable con la conducta de 5 traidores del ao Ulsa que vendieron el pas a los agresores japoneses.
					
					Lo que llama la atencin en la mudanza de bases norteamericanas y la construccin de las nuevas es el traslado de los enclaves al norte del ro Han hacia el sur.
					
					La base de Phyongthaek en plena construccin dar alojamiento a las tropas norteamericanas a evacuar de sus bases de Ryongsan de Sel, Tongduchon y Uijongbu.
					
					Esto parte del astuto intento de EE.UU. de alejar a sus tropas del alcance de implacable ataque del ejrcito de la RPDC y echar al ejrcito surcoreano como carne de can cuando se provoque la guerra en la Pennsula Coreana.
					
					A pesar de esto, el crculo gobernante surcoreano invierte en el traslado y la ampliacin de bases militares norteamericanas fabulosos impuestos recaudados al pueblo. Esta estupidez significa una vergenza nacional y se suma al siniestro mtodo de agresin de EE.UU. que pretende causar la pelea fratricida entre los coreanos.
					
					Debido a las bases de tropas norteamericanas situadas en varios lugares del Sur de Corea, el territorio coreano se convierte en zona devastada y se eleva cada da ms el peligro de guerra.
					
					Las autoridades surcoreanas sern condenadas siempre como vendepatrias si siguen actuando de esa manera.

articles.title: Se ofrecen funciones de primera jornada del 27 FAAAP
articles.content:
Se ofrecen funciones de primera jornada del 27 FAAAP
						
Pyongyang, 12 de abril (ATCC) -- Tuvieron lugar exitosamente el da 11 en 8 teatros capitalinos, incluyendo el Gran Teatro de Pyongyang, el Gran Teatro de Pyongyang Este, el Teatro Moranbong y la Casa de Msica Yun I Sang, las funciones de la primera jornada del XXVII Festival Artstico de Amistad Abril en Primavera (FAAAP).
					El solista del Grupo "Orfei" del Teatro de pera de Sofa, Bulgaria, y su comitiva pusieron en la escena el inmortal himno revolucionario "Cancin del General Kim Il Sung".
					
					La Orquesta Sinfnica de Provincia de Jilin de China dej profundamente impresionado al pblico al interpretar excelentemente el segundo movimiento "Aoramos su radiante sonrisa" de la sinfona "El Lder vive siempre con nosotros" que refleja infinito respeto y veneracin al Presidente Kim Il Sung.
					
					Los artistas del Ballet Clsico de Mosc ejecutaron la "Danza de Rusia" del "Lago de Cisnes" demostrando con sus dinmicos movimientos la idiosincrasia del pueblo ruso.
					
					El tro de guitarristas cubanos interpret magnficamente con su sonora voz y diestro mtodo de tocar la cancin cubana "Hasta siempre Comandante".
					
					La Banda de Cmara Alberic Magnard de Francia ejecut bien en el cuarteto de instrumentos de cuerda la msica de Haendel "Sarabande" y la otra de Johann Pachelbel "Canon".
					
					Mientras tanto, la danza en grupo "Dilogo", ofrecida por el Conjunto Artstico de Coreanos Residentes en Japn, describi bien la esperanza y el anhelo del pueblo coreano de vivir felizmente en un territorio tras reunificar la patria mediante la unidad de toda la nacin.
					
					Los artistas de Belarus, Mongolia, Finlandia, Rumania, Austria, Alemania, Ucrania y otros pases y los coreanos en ultramar salieron a la escena con los programas de alto nivel ideo-artstico y de fuerte matiz nacional que traducan la aspiracin de los pueblos a vivir dignamente estrechando los lazos de amistad en un nuevo mundo pacfico bajo la bandera de independencia.
					
					Disfrutaron los espectculos los miembros del comit organizador del festival y otos funcionarios, trabajadores, jvenes y estudiantes de esta capital, los huspedes extranjeros y los compatriotas residentes en el extranjero que se encuentran ahora en Corea.
					
					El festival contina.
